materials.raw_text: Co: 16 g, Er: 3 g, Mo: 2 g, P: 12 g, Tm: 3 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Metal supply stores or online suppliers; Er: Rare earth material suppliers; Mo: Metal supply stores; P: Chemical supply stores; Tm: Rare earth material suppliers.
steps: Co: Metal supply stores or online suppliers; Er: Rare earth material suppliers; Mo: Metal supply stores; P: Chemical supply stores; Tm: Rare earth material suppliers.
1. Weigh out 16 g of cobalt (Co) powder.
2. Weigh out 3 g of erbium (Er) powder.
3. Weigh out 2 g of molybdenum (Mo) powder.
4. Weigh out 12 g of phosphorus (P) powder.
5. Weigh out 3 g of thulium (Tm) powder.
6. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container.
7. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to achieve a uniform blend.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh out 16 g of cobalt (Co) powder. 
 2. Weigh out 3 g of erbium (Er) powder. 
 3. Weigh out 2 g of molybdenum (Mo) powder. 
 4. Weigh out 12 g of phosphorus (P) powder. 
 5. Weigh out 3 g of thulium (Tm) powder. 
 6. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 
 7. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to achieve a uniform blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures.
2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200 °C.
3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and mixing of materials.
heating.raw_text:
1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 
 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200 °C. 
 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and mixing of materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally, approximately 4-6 hours.
2. Avoid opening the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent oxidation or contamination.
cooling.raw_text:
1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally, approximately 4-6 hours. 
 2. Avoid opening the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent oxidation or contamination.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible.
2. Use sandpaper (grit 400 and 600) to smooth the surface of the sample.
3. Rinse the sample with distilled water to remove any remaining powder residue.
4. Allow the sample to dry completely before use or storage.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 
 2. Use sandpaper (grit 400 and 600) to smooth the surface of the sample. 
 3. Rinse the sample with distilled water to remove any remaining powder residue. 
 4. Allow the sample to dry completely before use or storage.
